info.headline: Lake Wind Advisory issued November 9 at 12:09PM EST until November 11 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Charleston SC
info.description:
* WHAT...For the Lake Wind Advisory on Lake Moultrie, west winds 15 to 25 knots with gusts up to 30 knots and waves 2 to 3 feet expected. For the Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures ranging from the mid to upper 20s inland to around freezing just inland from the beaches.
* WHERE...Inland Berkeley County.
* WHEN...For the Lake Wind Advisory, from 5 PM Monday to 4 AM EST Tuesday. For the Freeze Warning, from 9 PM Monday to 9 AM EST Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...Strong winds and rough waves on Lake Moultrie will create hazardous conditions for small craft. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blustery west to northwest winds will also push wind chill values into the upper teens to lower 20s inland to the mid to upper 20s at the beaches early Tuesday morning.
info.instruction:
Boaters on Lake Moultrie should use extra caution since strong winds and rough waves can overturn small craft.
Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.
To prevent water pipes from freezing; wrap or drain or allow them to drip slowly.

parameter.value: FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM MONDAY TO 9 AM EST TUESDAY... ...LAKE WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM MONDAY TO 4 AM EST TUESDAY ON LAKE MOULTRIE
